channel.title: Starting servers in linux
channel.description:
usually I do a simple [code]java server[/code] in the terminal to load the server obviously I can't run the batchfiles most server distributions include along with the server code, and unfortunately copy and paste methods don't work.
I'm wondering if by simply executing [code]java server[/code] if I'm missing something. Are there any other linux users out there who have encountered issues such as missing data whilst running server code? Have you found a solution to that?
Mostly I notice errors regarding to files not being found due to code written for windows file system architectures and not linux fs architectures.

item.title: Starting servers in linux
item.dc:creator: @darthtuxius darthtuxius
item.description:
@darthtuxius wrote:

usually I do a simple java server in the terminal to load the server
obviously I can’t run the batchfiles most server distributions include along with the server code, and unfortunately copy and paste methods don’t work.

I’m wondering if by simply executing java server if I’m missing something. Are there any other linux users out there who have encountered issues such as missing data whilst running server code? Have you found a solution to that?

Mostly I notice errors regarding to files not being found due to code written for windows file system architectures and not linux fs architectures.
